author: Jas1052
body: I think this is a result of Cisco pummeling Juniper in market share. They also have decreasing revenue yoy by 4%, which is a red flag during a growth period.

author: pkincy
body: I am not mad that TSLA has been increasing in value.  I have no dog in that hunt.  The fact that is irrational is simply an opinion and maybe you are right that, "it Truly is Different This Time."  I really wasn't happy when JNPR went to the teens as I had bought in at $63, $84 and $112, but that was a long time ago.  I wasn't happy when ADAP went bankrupt as I had paid in the $40's.  I wasn't real happy when Exodus went BK as I had bought in in the $60's.   But back then I was young and stupid and really thought it was "Different This Time."  We ignored debt and little to no earnings because Growth was going to carry us all to the Moon.

author: GenericUsername73
body:
I am more intrigued by forced shift in sourcing for UK importers' actual stuff than in securities of any sort. I think the real opportunities are tariff arbitrage. I've give a micro example.

The gin industry is booming right now. Quite a few small brands starting and consumption trending upward. However, the majority of the botanical ingredients in gin are sourced from EU states. Depending on how the deal is structured, those botanicals could become no longer cost competitive pretty soon. 

UK gin producers could see their primary inputs increase in price literally overnight. That creates an opportunity for anyone with access to, for example, juniper berries, in a nation with whom UK has low tariffs for that particular commodity.

There are tons of pecialty commodities falling under this general heading of "imminent potential tariff arbitrage opportunity". The trick is:
   1. You probably need to hire a customs broker to identify them
  2. we won't know what they are until the end of this year, ir until a deal is signed, whichever comes first.
   3. You need a relationship with a real counterparty. Can't trade juniper berries in your fidelity account.

author: throwaway_0x90
body:
Honeywell - I had to order 2 Honeywell heaters online for the winter because every local store within a 75 mile radius was sold out of them. Buy calls

McDonald's - every location I've driven past is empty, buy puts

Chevron - how does a gas station not do well? Buy calls

Juniper - American based networking & cyber security is a hot market these days and this company knows what they're doing, buy calls

Tesla - Musk could just smoke weed and talk about farms on Mars and stock would pump, buy calls

Starbucks - every location is full of people, buy calls

Facebook - a lot of money in political ads filled with misinformation, buy calls

UPS - they were driving all over the place this past Xmas season, buy calls

author: PROGRAMMER_FOR_TRUMP
body: Does anyone work with Juniper Networks hardware/software? I think this company is going to tank.
